text: At home with a bottle kindly shared by Maakun, thanks! Hazy golden with white head. Grassy and fruity notes up front. Elderflower, cow parsley, lime, lemon, white grapes, grapefruit, apricot, berries, flower hearts. Moderate sweet and bitter, tart fruity department. Medium body, dry and full of nectar, very juicy, and dense, nice solid stuff. Living stereo picnic porn beer.

Bottle shared. Hazy yellow golden with fizzy white head. Lemon, light fruit blossoms, pineapple, light funk, soft bread, hay, soft bitter herbs, a bit of cheese. Quite fruity with light funk, not very malty but theres some bread and a hint of oats. Light sour and bitter with very light sweetness. Under medium bodied with soft carbonation. Really my kind of beer. Lovely.

Po otwarciu butelki uderzenie Brettowe - zagroda, końska derka, całkiem miłe zaskoczenie. Po ogrzaniu wychodzi lakto - a powinno być chyba odwrotnie. Generalnie po ogrzaniu wiele traci, więc należy pic mega schłodzone. Piwo lekkie, pijalne, niezwykle gładkie. Za ciało daje 5 - jak na piwo z takim plato i w ogóle jest ponad wzorcowe. Generalnie lekkie, przyjemne, orzeźwiające w słonecznie i ciepłe dni.
Lots of lemon and some farm type hay aroma. Hazy orange pour with good head and lacing. Sour finish like your wife dumped you and stole your beer stash. Tap at Sovereign.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Bevuta a Birre Sotto lAlbero 2016. Oro acida, appena torbida, schiuma bianca leggera. Al naso è molto rustica, bretta, note agrumate, limone, formaggio. In bocca è un po spigolosa e leggera di corpo, mediamente acida. Carbonazione fine. Delude un po le attese.

Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà in Rome-Italy with Mortlach. quite cloudy orange pour with a white foamy head. Nose: sweet notes of grapefruit, lime, soft herbal notes. Mouth: more grapefruit, bitter/tart soft taste, clean finish.

Bottle Xmas 2016 gathering, thanks Mike! Pours hazy straw lots of head and lacing. Notes of lemon, soap, cereal, some yeast and light grassy. Taste medium/light tart, light sweet. Full creamy body light carbonation.

A hazed golden ipa with a thin white head. In aroma, beautiful sweet fruity malt with loads of catty citrusy floral hops, light fruity esters, light Brett, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light fruity esters, citrusy goodness, light creamy notes, nice. Bottle at Ottawa Xmas gathering 2016.
Cloudy orange of color with a white head. An aroma of citrus, spice and sour. A flavor lemon, citrus, sour and dry.

750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange color with small white head. A big citrus soft woody nose. The flavor is lemons, sour sawdust big funky tropical brett. Bready biscuit malt base. Pretty light and smooth. Quite drinkable.

750 mL bottle from the brewery, 3/24/16. Hazy orange, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of yeast, wheat, oats, orange, pineapple, guava. The taste is yeast, apple, oats, wheat, spice, lime, lemon. Mediumbodied, bright, refreshing, lingering tartness, bordering on funkiness.
Bottle at Culmination Fest 16: Poured a cloudy golden with a white fluffy head. Aroma was fruity, yeast, straw, and barn yard. Taste is a bit sour with fruit and esters, some wheat bitterness.

Fresh bottle at home. This is a really simple, 4% beer that allows that Hill Farmstead yeast and water combination to really shine through. The base malt is slightly grainy and light, but theres so much flavor from the yeast esters that it tastes like its an 8% beer. Fantastic.

Poured from a bottle into a sample glass: Pours hazy straw with a small white head. Aroma of bread, lemons, pepper, and funky yeast. Taste more of the same, very light, lightly tart, really drinkable but not the best griz Ive had.

Pours a murky golden with 2 finger head that quickly dissipated and leaves no lacing. At one of malt,apricot, peach, funk . Mildly sweet up front then mild butter. Low booze. Incredibly drinkable. Soft carbonation. Light on the palate. Medium Brett finish
On tap at Warpigs. Clear golden with whiteish head. Aroma has bread, slight fruit and brett. Taste is similar. Nice and clean, pleasant.

750mL bottled 6/12/15, drunk 6/3/16, thanks to Nelson.Burnished copper with a strong rusty-iron hue. Good clarity and an off-white head atop that is large and slowly recedes to cover.Light souring agents in the nose mix with very strong minerals, plenty of hay, and fresh wheat-like cereal notes. As usual, the house character is charming and with warming, a moderate fruitiness emerges, full of cherry, apple and strawberry, that lightens the otherwise somewhat austere wheat and bacteria/brett characteristics (austere but still enjoyable and highly aromatic). A lot going on here for only 4% but not messy/overdone in the least.Soft, nearly slick at times, texture shows very well-attenuated malts, light wheat and fine carbonation. Tart, I wouldnt say sour, with strawberry and light cherry skin-like fruitiness adding vibrancy. Light honey, baguette and vanilla notes add complexity, from the malt/wheat and it ends with just a bit of peppery phenol. No alcohol, of course, and no flaw. Maybe just a bit too much tartness and strong fruitiness with the specialty malt characteristics not providing enough softness. Maybe not the best version to age, as more base malt sweetness and less bacterial/brett character might actually be preferable here. Still one of the better grisettes Ive had, and fun to try it with a year of age.

[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Clear golden. Aroma is funky, floral, peppery, fruity, with some vinegar. Tart flavor, funky, fresh fruits, vinegar, a peppery note, earth, and a bitterish finish. Medium-bodied. Really good and refreshing.

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Day - Warpigs Brewpub, København
Pours clear deep golden with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, yeast, funk, brett, mango and grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long funky, grape, yeasty and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Draught at WarPigs Brewpub, Hill Farmstead Day. Clear dark golden in body colour, filmy layer, dotted spots on the glass. Bread and mid-tart fruits on the nose. Mixed taste of bread-like malts and yeasty fruitiness. Drying, mid-tart ending. Medium to thin bodied. Easy to drink and quite nice (shared with KimJohansen and Skinnyviking, Copenhagen 12.05.2016).
On tap at Warpigs, pre-CBC. Clear pale yellow with almost no head. Smells like a lambic, slightly tart and diluted. Sour and pretty refreshing.
Sample at Warpigs during the HF event. Light and fruity smell with green apples. Similar taste. Spritsy carbonation. Refreshing.

Bottle @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of light malt, yeast, light sourness, hay, light tart fruit, grapes. Flavor is light sour, light malt, yeasty, hay, light spice, tart fruity. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, light acidic finish. 120516

Pours a cloudy gold with a profuse carbonation and short lived white head. Nose is zesty and peppery with a light acidity and fruity notes. Bright acidity and zesty citrus with a dry finish and light body.

Bottle. Willeys Store, Greensboro, VT. Very hazy, straw colour. Streams of fine bubbles. Thick, dense, glossy topped, sticky, white head. Looks great. Nose has lemon meringue. Yeasty, bready malts. Some pithy hop. Notes of vanilla biscuit. Fresh and bright. Taste is light, yeasty dry. Some lip sticking sweetness. Clean, light, zesty mouthfeel. A little thin, maybe. Finishes with a soft, clean, gooseberry, tangy bitterness.

February 26, 2016. Bottled september 2014.

Hazy orange with a medium sized white head. Aroma is fruity, some lemon, lime zest, grapes, slight herbal and spicy. 
Taste is light sweet, tart citrusy with a refreshing finish, lemon juice, lime zest, some herbal notes, typical HF funk. Light to medium bodied, soft to medium bodied. 


Very good!
A: Deep orange with a thin white lacing N: Mango, orange T: Mango, orange O: Very nice balanced beer!
The usual barnyardy grassy wheaty elements with the typical HF tart funky yeast. Its yet another really solid Saison.
Bottle split a few ways. Hazy golden pour with a very generous head. Notes of light citrus, hay, lemon juice, some funk, wheat and some light honey.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur orangée pâle translucide, mousse blanc cassé laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de Brett, pomme, acidité, céréales, foin, un peu vineux, citron. Goût de Brett, céréales, bonne acidité, pomme sûre, herbal, légère amertume en fin de bouche. Carbonatation élevée, corps moyen.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange golden, light sediment, 1 finger light off-white head. Aroma is yeast, sweet, light sugar, wheat, brett, light mold, citrus and orange zest, mandarin tang. Taste is very citrusy and lemonade alike. Brett, fruits, tang, tart wheat, sour peach, herbal finish and leafs. Light bodied, big taste, light dry, so smooth. Very crisp!

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is very zesty, funky, a bit of grains, bready and cereal. Light bitter and light sweet. Dry, very quaffable. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Great!

Bottle at No Homo bottleshares. Pours a beautiful orangy yellow with a creamy, white head. Aroma has brett, dry saison yeast, wheat, bread, citrus peel, lime, grape fruit. Slight citra-ish hops. Taste is citric, dry, grape fruity, juicy, light, hoppy, spicy. Super tasty for 4%. Average to medium high carbonation, light, crisp body without being watery.

750ml bottle. Cloudy amber orange with a frothy white head. Flavors are bread, wheat, lemon peel and grass with floral and funky notes. Light tartness. Light body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Bottle. Poured a slightly hazy golden orange color with a big foamy white head. Aromas of the typical HF yeast strand, funk, some cherry, and hay. Flavor had lemon, cherry, tons of grain, funk, straw, yeast, spice. Light body and a sticky texture to it. Carbonation was pretty high and the finish was smooth and easy.

Bottle, from JulienHuxley-- thanks! Shared with Parksy and Grippitis. Murky, chalky greyish yellow with a finely bubbled white head. Tart lemon peel and funky sweaty wheat, nice and rustic, light and refreshing. Tart, with a dry minerally finish.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: bottle shared by a friend. poured a murky hazy dark golden to light orange colour with a nice fluffy hill farm head on top. nose has some funky influences in there, combined with your typical hill farmstead yeast. lots of wheats and grains in there, refreshing citrus, pale crisp malts, and some slight spice pepper yeast. clean crispy mouthfeel. but im getting a bit to much wheat in there. cut grass, and juicy lemon apples, mouthfeel is perfectly carbonated, with a nice crisp mouthfeel. this is just a saison, have no ideaa why this is linked to a tradionial ale

Bière dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina en cuisinant un boeuf bourguignon. La bière est claire, mousseuse et à linstar de toutes ses consoeurs de la même brasserie, très appétissante! Nez de Brettanomyces où quelques agrumes jouent un rôle plaisant et rafraîchissant. Un citron Meyer. La présence de jolis malts me plaît également malgré leur grande discrétion. En bouche le liquide est bien sec malgré une effervescence marquée. Encore un citron doux et une amertume délicate. Un peu de foin mais ça reste très simple. Une bière facile à boire en après-midi mais qui manque de complexité à mon avis. De loin la plus "ordinaire" de cette brasserie qui ne verse jamais dans lordinaire.

750ml bottle from the brewery. Aroma: green apples, touch of citrus and grains and pepper. App: clear pale with small white head, little retention. Taste and palate: thin body, soft carbonation, grassy, light bitter finish. Overall: well made even though not exactly my style. Quite boring style to be but well made. Nothing really stands out so good balance. Not amazing but highly drinkable.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a decent white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, and grain. Taste is citrus, yeast, fruit, wheat, and spice. Very nice.

Bottle at him. Pours orange with no head. Aroma of tart, yeast, very flowery hops. Taste hops, fruity, hoppy, light sour,, citrus, grass. Leading to a quite dry finish. Very high drinkability, so balanced. Woaw.

One finger foam. Barnyard mushroom. Delicate well balanced sourness. Citrus. More sour than vinegar. Super.

750 mL bottle poured into a Hill Farmstead wine glass. Originally reviewed 10/30/2012.
 Hazy golden body with a very large white head. Lace clings to the sides of the glass, but never fully settles. A pillow of foam on the surface.

Yeasty aroma, like Anna. Lots of hay and wheat. Bright acidic lemon aroma.

Tart flavors are immediately apparent. Cracker malt flavor. Lots of wheat. Yeasty, but not as much as the nose. Peppery finish.
 Grainy, pleasantly sour. Well carbonated. Light and easy to drink.

 This was my first Hill Farmstead beer years ago at the Blackback Pub. Revisiting it for the first time. Admittedly, its not Hill Farmsteads best beer, but it caught my interest back then and has held it ever since.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold, medium white creamy head, long lasting, nice lacing. Aroma is dusty, hay, a hint of salt. Flavor is light sweet, very light tart, mineral water, wheat, light lemon notes, minimal bitterness. Light body and super easy drinking.

Bottle pours with a papery opaque golden body that supports an off white head. The aroma offers up spicy yeasty notes and then theres lots of floral and flowery meadow going on as well. The taste starts with crisp mild tartness that heads toward flowery floral notes and spicy yeastiness. Into the finish it picks up the addition of some vague fruitiness. Hmm. Pretty nice.

Many thanks Jason - bottled in 9 of 2015!! Pours a slightly hazy yellow gold with a nice off-white head. The smell is wheat, spice, tart fruit. The taste is tart fruit, dull malt, wheat, spice ending dry and very crisp. Light in body with slightly above average carbonation. Very interesting brew!

Many thanks to Rian for sharing. Sourish but fresh nose. Easy to drink beginning. Hints of malt. Nice citrus-horse blanket-sourness. Tart but fresh. Nice not too intense bitterness in the end, round, tart. Hints of grain, fresh smooth, round and sourish. Nice.

Bottle shared by Koen @ "Zunt Om Nog Langer Te Bewaren" tasting (ZONLTB). Hazy yellow orange color, average sized white head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, orangepeel, lightly citrus. Taste yeast, wheat, orangepeel, citrus, a little dry, a hint of apricot. Easy drinkable, well balanced. Have to admit, very nice beer.

Bottle @ SONLTB tasting. Hazy yellow to orange colour with a small white head. Smells sour, fruity, brett, leather. Tastes sourish, fresh, fruity, apricot. Lovely. Soft, slightly fizzy carbo (which suits the beer), medium body. Great!

Bottle. Hazy golden orange beer with a small white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of citrus, grapefruit, peaches, spices and grass. Flavor is spicy with notes of citrus, wheat, yeast, salt, pepper and spices. Well balanced.

Bottle thanks to trade with jdb288! Pours a hazy yellow with bubbly white head that lasts. Aroma is awesome, kiwi and tropical fruit notes over funk. Taste follows with wheat accents, wow, smooth. Really nice!

Bottle (09/2014). Pours golden with a moderately lasting white head. First pour from the bottle was clear; second pour was opaque. Distinctive HF yeast aroma, some light citrus. Lightly tart; light and bright lemon. Light bodied; average, but lively carbonation; refreshing.
Smells like a great saison. Taste is standard saison plus juicy tropical fruit. Medium body, low to medium carbonation, a slight foam.

Pour from a 750 at the dirty fib kbs bottle share. Slight tart, touch of sour. Lots of farmhouse, grass, hay, lemon. some say horse blanket, but this was more like being at a petting zoo. Slight pepper. More barnyard, farmhouse yeast than most HF saisons. Nice.

Clara is a thing of yeasty, funky glory. She pours golden yellow with lots of head. The effervescent, fizzy body is like that of a Lambic, but the long-lasting, big head is what youd expect from a well-made Farmhouse Ale. Its no great surprise, then, that Clara smells and tastes like each. Smell has sour funk, bright yeast, bread, and citrus. Taste features vinegar, earthy and fruity yeast, sweet malt, lemon juice, and some black pepper. Mouthfeel is smooth and slightly crisp. Clara packs a ton of flavor and complexity into her 4% ABV body. Shes a purists dream. People who love yeasty brews owe it to themselves to try Clara.

(Thanks Adam "AdamJackson") 

Bottle.

A- Vinegar, citrus, lemon, champagne, tart.

A- Golden orange color, cloudy milky liquid, white head.

T- Vinegar, citrus, slightly sweet, tart, effervescent, subtle spice.

P- Light body, average texture, high carbonation, tart finish.

O- This was about 7 months old and probably would have been even more amazing but I wanted to save it for my 600th rating. Sure glad I did. Lots of vinegar and citrus on the nose and palate. Looks like someone cracked an egg yolk in the glass with the nice milky appearance. I probably liked it better than my rating shows. Very well done beer. Hard to believe this is only 4% abv.
Cloudy orange-yellow with a pale head. Aroma is hay, saison spice, green pepper. Light bodied, lightly spicy on the palate. Taste is saison spice, green olive.
Shared bomber to snifters. Light colored. Slight funk and citrus in both aroma and flavor.

On tap at the Abbey. Pours orange with a small head. Aroma is tangy citrus. Flavor was tart and dry, nice clean beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from my buddy Pat, thanks man! Cloudy yellow colour with frothy white head. Aroma is dusty white grape funk, citrus, and grass. Taste is light tart funk, citrus, a hint of bitterness, with a juicy tart finish, medium bodied. Very quenching, with an exceptional amount of flavour and complexity for a beer that weighs in at mere 4%, solid body as well, wow.
750ml bottle. Poured a cloudy yellow color with a smaller sized head. Citrus, wheat, spicy, and some fruitiness.

Bottle @ THT January. Pours a hazy golden beer with a big white head on top. Slightly gushing out of the bottle. Aroma of saison yeast, apples, pear, grass and citrus. Flavor is fairly bitter, grapefruits and sweet citrus notes. Some hoppy notes in the back end there and has some sweet citric notes in the back. Quite ok.

Bottle shared at Deans off for his annual haircut tasting. Pours cloudy dull golden with a white head. Aroma of light bretty funk, citrus, slight leafy and weedy. Flavour is light salty and a slight touch acidic. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.

Bottle @THT Jan 2015 courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin white head. Cloudy blond pour. Not really my thing.
Poured hazy light orange amber with a disappearing off white head. Aroma is spicy, apple, red berries, light yeast. Medium body, flavour is wheaty, medium sweet, lightly bitter, moderately spiced.
Hazy golden yellow pour. Frothy white head. Aromas of hay and lemon. Taste is light sour funk. Really well balanced. Medium light body and medium high carb.

Light frothy, fast fading off white head, golden light hazy colour. Notes of wet wheat/cereal, fresh green apple and pear aromas develop; subtle and well concipated. Light lively with a light slick texture slowl developping and light body. Acidity is well kept in check by some sweetness and bitterness forming the backbone of this beer. Light dry finish.
Bottle. Pours a golden yellow with white head. Aroma is fruity, funky, tart, light, nice. Taste is light, refreshing, fruity, really nice and easy drinking beer. I could drink this all day.

Bottle: Liquid gold color; bright & breaming with 100% opacity. Soapy, slushy white head builds up quickly, then breaks itself down just as fast. Mild splotchy lacing. Smells like a farm at sunrise. Notes of grass, heavy must, lemon-lime zest, a touch of funky cheese, damp barnyard, faint spicy yeast esters, vibrant breadiness, & a hint of light citrus spritz. Smells so refreshing, dry, & well put together. A touch of tartness nips the tongue with each sip; hints of lemon zest, citrus, & faint stone fruit. Lightly leafy & grass laden hops, just outside the floral realm. Mid-palate shows a touch of musty hay funk, driftwood, damp cheesecloth, & notes of a dusty, damp barnyard floor. Finishing with touches of lemon zest, apple skin, & a dry snap of the yeast. Tight like a tiger. Lovely at only 4% ABV, a great table beer. Would love to dome this juice year round.
750 ml bottle thanks to MacBoost. Light in color with some funk in nose and yeast and lemon zest throughout. Lightly hopped. Really nice.

Bottle. Clear gold pour with a a very small fizzy head that fades to a thin ring. Aromas are lemon zest, leather, grainy wheat, light barnyard, and light berries, Very dry taste. Lots of leather and lemons. Light tartness. Some grain, flowers and barnyard too. Another really good one from Hill Farmstead.

Bottle: Thanks Jdb288: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Almost gusher. Medium sized creamy foamy head. Hazy yellow with orange tints.
Aroma is fruity, floral, flowers, lemon, grapes, some citrus, some berries, tart fruity and some fruity funky yeast tones.
Flavour is fruity tart, fruity, some bitters, yellow and orange fruit, some berries, yeast, light subtle tartness with lighter bitters, some soap and floral tones. Delicious and crispy stuff with a subtle and very enjoyable tartness to keep it crisp enough!
Aftertaste is tart from different fruit tones with hints of yeast, floral tones and some slight hints of rhuharb and flowers.
Medium to fuller carbo, just a bit more than medium bodied and a light creamy tart mouthfeel.
Delicious stuff! Crispy and lovely flavours! Could drink this all dy and night and still not (too) pissed!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Zesty lemon aroma. Lightly farmy. Grainy. Hazy orange. Taste is lightly tart. Also zesty lemon in flavor. Very thin. Light grain. Quenching
Bottle - Light grains, grass, citrus and some funk. Cloudy orange with a decent white head. Tart and soured malts, some light wheat notes and a bit of grassy funk. Like it.

Bottle from the source - picked this up at HF myself. Opaque yellow pour with white frothy head. Aroma of lemon peel, sawdust, hay. Taste is tart and crisp...lemon/citrus with some grassy hop notes. Lovely.
750, capped and corked. Pours a cloudy medium amber with a loose white head. Big eggy nose. Soft caramel and egg mid palate. Mild sweet finish.
Bottle, with some nasty smegma around the rim. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Yeast and mild citrus bouquet. Tart lemon and citrus notes dominate. Mild yeast lowlights. Unique.
Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy white head. The aroma is strong wheat, yeast, oak. Medium mouth with nice dry wheat, light citrus. Very nice.

Pours a hazy pale orange / yellow, light white head. Aroma is must, basement grime, lemon funk, lemongrass, hay, mineral, earth, wheat. Flavor is pale bread, tart lemon, lingering earth & tart. Heavy wheat, grain, and tart throughout.

Bottle via unknown from Lawson. Pours a pale golden color, little bit of head. Aroma crisp, floral and estery, hibiscus. Body fluffy and crisp, finish slightly spicy with a bit of tangy herbal quality, too.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Funk, floral, grassy, and citrus aromas. Flavors are similar, not very wild; lemon and musky finish.

Sample at the 2014 Infected Chimipalooza on 11/01/2014. Hazy orange-gold color with a thin dense white head that diminishes gradually. Short strings of lacing. Barnyard aroma with fruit and yeast notes. Light-bodied with flavors of peaches, citrus, funky yeast and grassy hops. The finish is mildly tart with a delicately fruity aftertaste. Enjoyable beer all around.
sample at Crabapples bottle share. another winner from HF. lemon, barnyard funk, floral, hay. great
Bottle. Surly Darkness Eve 2014. I am unable to find written tasting notes on this.
Bottle shared at Darkness day. Pours hazy golden with minimal head. Smell of citrus funk and barnyard notes. Taste of lemon citrus with nice clean finish. Good stuff.

Pours a light hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of funk, sour wheat, earth and hay. Taste is tart wheat, funk and a citrusy finish. Light yet really flavorful. I would drink this all the time if I could!

Bottle from brewery. Pours a clear gold with a large white head. Aromas of lemon and hay, grassy fields. Taste is lightly tart, lightly bitter and off dry. Flavors of lemon pith, some light cracker type malt. A subtle funk and tartness. This is a very quenching and very relaxing beer that I could drink all day. Near perfection. Seriously.
Bomber. Hazy yellow pour with a small head. Light lemon, wheat. A little funky barnyard. Yeast. Good stuff.

Une grisette blonde et voilée avec une petite mousse fondante. Un nez céréalier, montagnard et campagnard avec des agrumes et des fleurs. Un goût acidulé et floral avec des brettanomyces et des citrons. Un corps à 4% bien gonflé. Une finale développée par les levures. Bière bien correcte. Elle a la qualité dêtre facile à boire.
Bottle from moc, also shared with merc. Pours hazy Amber, prickly carbonation. Lightly sour, lemons, mild dirt. Light body. Another Shawn hill saison no essay needed.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of yeast and a dairy farm. Medium sour and lightly bitter, flavors of citrus, most notably lemon, light body, average carbonation, thin texture and a long lightly bitter finish.

Bouteille de 750ml (merci Patrick) 09-2014. Une bière jaune avec une mousse blanche durable. Un nez qui sent la sécheresse, le blé, la levure. Une bouche sèche, classique, blé. Une finale très sèche à la limite astringente. Ce boit seul.

Taster from a bottle at the source. Orange straw with a white head. Aroma is barnyard, oatmeal, stone fruit. Tart and dry with flavors of green apple, wheat bread, lemon. Grainy wheat bread crust and a touch of salt on the finish.

Bottle @ home....to celebrate the name of one of my best friends daughter...It pours hazy golden with a white head... sour, tart, grapefruit, barnyard, fruits nice light acidic, brett.... very nice! love it...

(retrieved from 08/2013 Midwest jpg backlog, CHI tasting - big bottle courtesy of CHI tasting crew, thx). Dry and fluffy lemon-forward grisette in the best of sessionable traditions: lactic wheat components deliver great gentle tartness, dry yeast without too much brett at work on palpably quality pale malt, clean body, a crisp finish with a late citric rind hop zing leaves you eager for another sip/bottle/or, in the case of our CHI police crew: to jump back in your van for another 1000-mile haul to VT...

Thanks Kingcecil for sharing this treat. It pours hazy golden with a dense white head. The aroma is grapefruit, barnyard, sour fruits and fruity hops. The flavor is light acidic and grapefruit hoppy with brett and some tart notes. Very drinkable.

[5280-20130427] 750mL bottle. Plasticky yeast grass aroma. Clear, pale orange body with a medium-lasting foamy head. Sour yeast and lemon hops flavour. Medium body is pretty sour. Tasty, drinkable, very nicely balanced. (7/4/8/4/17). 4.0
(@ Prohibition Pig, Waterbury, VT)

750ml bottle (6/13 dated, 8 months in the bottle) pours semi-clear pale golden straw with 2 finger head. Nose is earthy yeast, citrus, straw, lime. Crisp, light body, refreshing. Pleasantly light with lots going on, nice.

750 ml bottle shared by Drew. Thanks, dude! Pours a rich hazy pour, good deeper dark gold pour. Some frothy offwhite head. Aromas are a bit salty, some citrus, grass, florals, and herbs. Gentle spice. Initial is lighter end of medium bodied, gentle bread, dough, and spice. Mellow yeast. Gentle spice. Kiss of tartness, lemon, and grass. Middle is gentle bread, tartness, mellow carbonation, dry and gentle spice. Lemon, grass, and dry florals. Touch of tartness into the finish, with dry florals and grass, gentle spice, kiss of lemon, rind, and mellow flavors and dryness. Nice beer, sessionable.

Bottle. Beautiful opaque bright yellow-beige with white head that recedes quickly in a ring of foam. Aroma is rustic and farmhouse, old wheat, lemon and hay. Definitly funky. I really like the wheat profile. Taste is tart as per Hill Farmstead yeast. Wheat provides some body. I find it very mineral and earthy. Mouthfeel is deliciously dry and light-medium bodied. Very tasty but I dont like it is very sessionnable as it is a little too tart. As good as this is, I miss the Hill Farmsteads saisonthat werent soured by the yeast.

(Draught) very cloudy, thick frothy offwhite head. Nose of funk, dandelion, Belgian yeast and a bit tart. Taste of manure, funky, cream, light white peaches, dry as a bone and easy to drink. Nice enough, just not one of the standouts of the day.

Bottle shared by drewbeerme. I was in the minority as I actually preferred this to Arthur. Pours a pale gold with a persistent white head. I still feel this should be a saison, not a traditional ale. The nose is soft and clean, malty with a soft hop aromatic. Faint tartness in the nose, cherries and horseblanket? Super clean otherwise and soft. On tasting, light pepper and citrus, faint tart note. The grain is pure and clean, the yeast is fantastic. I love the light body without being thin. Refreshing and imminently quaffable. Superb.

Bottle, thanks AJ.  Pours a cloudy golden with a large frothy white head.  Nose is yoghurt, light eggs, salt, minerals, lemon, coriander.  Reminds me of a gose or heavier bodied Berliner weisse.  Flavor is similar, lightly minerally, salt, lightly herbal, faint lemon.  Drinks a little heavier than expected, bodywise.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours very hazy pale blond/whitish with low off-white head. Aroma is slightly funky, fruits, acidic, weird. Taste is acidic, citrus. Ligth body. Overall: Too weirdly acidic for me, not my kind of beer. Still drinkable.

Bottle shared by Minderbinder. Thats an old style that has been revived by various breweries already but I believe this one might be closer to the historical reality. Quenching for sure, it lacks the modern-y taste we are all used to. This makes for a product that is nice to have once but I wouldnt buy it again as it ultimately comes short of the HF standard.

Bottle (750 ml). Thanks to Minderbinder for sharing this one! Clear straw color with a small white and and some lacing. Aroma of sulfur, fruits with herbal and sour notes. Not quite impressive. Taste is better with more fruits, citrus, peppery notes. Rustic notes. Mouthfeel is a little watery but still decent body. Not my kind of beer...
UPDATED: APR 26, 2013 Very well crafted beer.  Carbonation and body spot on.  Bit salty and smokey seemingly, full rate to come.  3.6 [rerate]  soured up quite a bit, lovely.

Draft @ HFS Harvest Festival. Used a Hill Farmstead wine, stem glass. A nice bright yellow color with orange tints. Nose of malted wheat, oranges and has a light barnyard smell. Taste of mild floral hops, yeast, grass, spices and a real light Brett sour aspect. Texture is dry with a slight pucker effect. Really easy to drink at 4 %. I could drink this all afternoon, on a summer or fall afternoon. Refreshing.

750 ml bottle shared by bsuedekum- thanks again, Blake! Pours a cloudy pale gold color with a white head. Aroma of straw, farmhouse funk, wheat, citrus, herbs, pale malts, and faint pepper. Flavor of straw, pepper, farmhouse funk, dry grains, and citrus peel. Light-bodied, with a dry, funky mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Really nice farmhouse style ale. Probably could drink this all day.

(Bottle) Pours golden with a large, creamy white head. The aroma holds fresh grass, fresh herbs, lots of minerals, white bread, crackers, dust, old balanced phenols, barnyard, citric peel, grapefruit and lemon grass. A touch of tart fruits. The flavour is light sweet to dry, light bitter and ligt acidic with notes perfect balanced hops, dry/slim malt and complex yeast. The mouthfeel tight, crisp and light tart with light to medium carbonation. Mild citric, grassy, light funky and bready finish. Fancy afterbitterness. Some phenols. Light bodied.
tap at farmhouse fest. pours murky orange with white head. aroma of sweet malty spice. taste is some nutmeg? citrus and slight tart

Draught at the Festival of Farmhouse Ales. Kind of salmon-pink-orange, very cloudy, really nice head. Pretty. Really wheaty aroma, biscuits, malted wheat, kind of spicy with cloves. Really wheaty, malty, grainy taste, some esters, cloves, spicy. Really interesting and nice. Light sweetness, but very grainy. Dry finish, not really hoppy but nicely dry.

On tap at Hill Farmstead Farmhouse event - Bright orange with one finger head and decent lacing. Smell is dominated by wheat and orange peels. Taste is also dominated by wheat. Hints of tangerines, peaches and sugar. Very dry finish with mild bitterness.
tap.   rustic farmy wheat and dough. herbal.    slight raw vegetable  and grains note, which was fine.   refreshing.   sessionable.  nice beer.

On tap at 2012 Hill Farmstead Festival of Farmhouse Ales. Aroma has a Grisette-distinct rubbery Belgian phenol note. Of the three or four Grisettes Ive had or made, theyve all had this note. I dont know if the low gravity deprives the yeast of a nutrient level or what but this is a characteristic theyve all had. The flavors are broader with a nice snappy bitterness and lots of minerals. The weight and texture are perfect for the style. Refreshing.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. Slightly cloudy golden with a large lush white head. Floral aroma with notes of yeast, gunpowder, horse stables, hay, citrus and gentle smoke. Light bodied, crisp viscosity. Dry taste, medium bitter finish, grass, flowers.

Pretty stuff. Pours cloudy white gold; modestly thick white head, fantastic lacing. Nose is cream, earth, florals, spice, hops, citrus, very damn pretty. Flavours of cream, white pepper, yeast. Damn nice stuff!

8th May 2012Bottle in the Mikkeller bar shared with Anders37 - cheers mate! Light haze on this gold beer. Light palate a little dry. Very light carbonation. Creamy frothy! A little minerals and very mild wheaty malt. Very light orange. Some nice floral notes and a touch of vanilla. Frothy dry finish. Not bad but its all a bit of a frothy mess to be brutal.
Bottle. Pours a very pale yellow color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty yeasty aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy yeasty finish.

750 mL served in a tulip.

Hazy yellow with a soft white head. Nice retention and thick lacing. Aroma is floral, yeasty and bready. Mild sweetness, little hop or fruit presence. Light bodied, crisp and refreshing with a dry earthy finish. Strong malt body with a pleasant floral flavor throughout. A nice saison, but nothing exceptional.
sample at home ... golden amber ... thin white head ... soft zeztylemon nose ... little over fizzy ... light lemon hop .... light lemon peeel ... ok

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium yellow colour with a large to huge, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate hoppy, herbs, citrus, malty, moderate to heavy yeasty. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, fruity, yeasty, saison alike, citrus, peppery notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Very nice and refreshing and very tasty special with only 4% ABV. ;O) [20120330]

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a cloudy opaque golden with a huge white head with good retention. Fresh citrusy nose combined with a distinct yeastiness. Light body, heavy carbonation, floral and herbal, initially a little sweet fruitiness but turns more and more dry the closer you get to the finish - bordering astringency. Actually a very bitter finish - think dandelion juice or something. 300312

Bottle @ FOneFan. Hazy dark yellow with big white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, fruit, spices and hops. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, spices, high carbonation, little orange peel, hops, little citrus and quite bitter.
Botlle @ Fonefan tasting. Huge creamy head with good excellent duration. Color is golden and slightly hazy. Aroma and taste are wheat malt, fruits, hops, notes of citrus. Medium carbonation.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeasty and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. High carbonation. Very good for a 4 % ABV beer. 300312

750 ml bottle; vibrant gold with faint haze; heavy carbonation with egg white head; sharp lemon peel and fresh grass with almost a bubblegum; crisp and clean mouthfeel; clean malt profile that is both simple and complex at the same time; lively carbonation works with mix of sharp lemons, crisp malt and light grassy finish; could drink this all day; yum
On draft pour.  Golden color with a white head/  Crisp and refreshing with some lemon zest.  Could drink it all day in the summer.

75cl bottle, thanks Travlr.  Medium off-white head, cloudy apple cider body.  Aroma is medium sweet, spicy, some floral.  Taste is medium sweet, spicy, some citrus, light bread.  Light-medium body, somewhat dry finish.
750ml bottle shared by jsprime. bright golden big fluffy white head. without a doubt the best session weight beer ive eve had. bright , complex, but truely drinkable. amazing beer.
Not overly impressed but this one probably tasted exactly like intended.  Very light with a lot of yeast in the flavor.  Bready, spicy, lemon, and a crisp almost bitter yeasty finish.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 Huge foamy head. Lemony and very carbonated. Finishes like selzer. Plain simple style, not gonna do it for ya is you wanna get "crunked"
750 growler/bottle-shared by j12601-pours yellow with a disappearing foamy white head.  Aroma is dank/barn, light/medium malt.  Taste is dank/barn/grassy hops, light/medium malt.  Occasional.

75 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a huge white head. Aroma mild yeasty, hayish and slight grassy. Smooth orange, peachy and citrusy fruity. Crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity. Crisp hoppy finish.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2013 Hazy light gold pour.  Huge head.  Yeast and lemon in the aroma. Barnyard funk is noticeable at first, but gives way to White wine, yeast wheat and lemon peel.  Fairly lively carb.  Light and easy drinking.  Good summer drinker.  Ill take it over lemonade any day.

Draft. A yellow beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, spices, dusty hops, and newly cut hay. The flavor is sweet with notes of hay, straw, lemons, and dustsy hops, leading to a bitter finish. The body is light.

Pours a light coloured body with generous head.  Mild earthy aroma.  Not much going on, just a nice beverage that would be great in the summer, particularly with sessionability of abv.ABove average mouthfeel.
Johns bottle.

750ml bottle .. . pours a mild gold .. great foam .. light firm lacing .. yeast and wheat, with happy little trees .. . great mouthfeel and something i could drink loads of! .. . . 

what did he do to your dog?

Bottle/750ml - Pours a hazy golden yellow in color with a medium white head that settled to a quarter inch covering over the beer.  Aroma is of grass/hay, a small amount of barnyard funk, yeast, grassy hops, some Brett and some hint of light fruits (green apple, pear).  Flavor is a complex mix of bready yeasts, floral hops, mild Brett and spices...  Really good.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of spices, citrus peel, hops and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of spices, citrus peel, hops and pine needles.
Hoppy finish.
Bottle at MikkellerBAR. Cloudy yellow - white head. Sulphor. Yellow. Wheaty. Citrus. Bretty notes. Light bitterness. Zesty. Funky. Yeasty. Spicy. Nice.
bottle at mikkeller. Cloudy yellow, huge white head. Saison yeast, spices, fruit peel, dryness in the aroma. 7 flavor is flowery . Yeasty, saison yeast, leather, 7

Bottle shared by kschep. - Thanks! Pours weak hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is pear, hay, bright citrus fruits, fresh bready notes, yeasty saisonish notes, green grapes, weak brett, barnyard, some sweeter orange, straw, grassy hops and a rural feel to it overall. Taste is orange, grassy hops, yeasty wheat bread, pear, bright citrus fruits, grapes, saisonish dryness, weak funk, coriander and some piney notes leading to a dry end.

bottle thanks kschep! hazy golden yellow, langlasting white head, Aroma: Wood, dusty, musty, white grape skins, barnyard, brett, hay, wheat, yeast, light soapy,  vinous, citrussy hops, pineapple, red apples, overripe fruit, pear, melon, light acidity, some bready notes, Taste: tart, dry, crisp, wheat, peppery, hay, clover, pear, overripe fruit, dusty, apple, wood, brett, straw, fruity, bubblegum, light spiced, lemon peel, light soap. impressive considering the Abv. but a bit too "safe"

Nose is early milk, grape skin, yeast, stale mint, weak sweet soap, lavender, feel Is medium, carb is quite heavy, taste is heavy green grape skin, dry lemon, sauvignon blanc fruit, weak soap, late dough notes

720ml thanks to MtGoat.
Appearance : Clear yellow with huge foamy white head. Short head retention. Some lacing,

Aroma : Great malt with rustic yeast. Nice wheat with floral hops. Nicely rustic and countryside. Very fresh and nicely floral. Light fruity notes too. Great citrusy notes.

Palate : Carbonation is a bit intense at first but it settles down with time. Rather fizzy.

Taste : Very dry and sharp with chewy malts, sharp floral and herbal hops. Finish is very herbal with light citrusy notes and some hay.

Overall : Very light and drinkable. Would be a bit more drinkable if carbonation was a bit softer. Finish is very dry and sharp. Nose is awesome with great rustic notes. Taste also has some nice yeasty notes, Finish is slightly astringent probably because there is not much residual sugars. Lots of character for such a low abv beer. Very good as usual.

Bottle courtesy of Travlr, thank you! Poured a slightly cloudy golden color with a spicy, yeasty aroma. Flavor is heavy on the spice and yeast. Surprised by the 4% - pretty enjoyable but not totally my cup of tea.

Clear dark yellow pour with a gigantic, magnanimous frothy white head. The nose is absolutely wondrous, with notes of wheat, lemon, tangerine, parsley and thyme, and beautiful bready dough. The prevalance of the grain and dough still masterfully mixes with those vibrant herbal and citric qualities. The flavor is marvelously refreshing, and the crisp effervescence reminds me of a combination between Orval and a kristalweizen. A touch of earthy funk mixes with the aforementioned green pungency, along with hints of mango and white grapefruit. The palate is delightfully bubbly and crisp, but also yields a nice dryness from the bread components near the finish. So much going on for such a light beer. Expertly done, and delicious.

In short: A original semi-rustic wheat ale
How: Bottle 750ml.  A few times.  This rating for a fresh bottles a few weeks after the initial beer release
The look: Cloudy yellow blonde body topped by a large white head with good retention
In long: Nose is countryside field rustic, some wild flowers and freshly cut hay.  Taste has a lot of fresh hay in a fluffy body, plain wheat crackers, lemongrass, dried light color fruits, flowers, rustic yeast.  Finish is rather dry and tart with a mild citrusy bitterness.  As easy to drink as youd expect for a 4% beer yet there is a lot of things going on here and the beer feels quite original, almost unusual.  Lively light body.  I drank a few 750ml bottles of this beer in less than 15 minutes each, because I believe that life is too short to drink beer slowly or to remove USB devices safely.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2011 Hazy straw pour with a massive frothy white head. We had to be careful whilst pouring, as the head wanted to eat up most of the volume of the glass! Lots of lemony dough, floral herbals and earthen funk abound in the nose. Very dry and earthy with lemon, citrus rind, and curious woody tannic acidity. Tropical fruits and nectar fruits follow. Pineapple and apricot mostly. Medium body with perfect carbonation- fluffy and pillowy with a caressing finish.

750mL thanks to Travlr and oteyj. A giant white head erupts with incredible force like HF Vera Mae. Requires great patience to not get over zealous in pouring and creating a tulip that is 99% head and 1% beer. Huge retention and massive rockiness. SRM is a beautiful hazy straw, glowing. Ap5. Nose is delicate sweet apricot (dried) and mild peach with tropical perfume. Delicate flowers and more sweet apricot. Even some dried pineapple. Wow. N8. Taste is refreshing and doughy with small sweet apricot. Dry palate but not chalky or bland. Sharp, sparkling carbonation. P4. Refreshing overall. Nice grassy hoppiness for balance. In the taste, at first I got some plastic off flavor that thankfully disappears after decanting. T8. 8/5/8/4/16=4.1

Bottle Pours a murky off-white with a creamy, white head.  Good retention. Fruity, spicy, grainy bouquet  lemon peel, coriander and cereal grains. Light-bodied with Champagne-like carbonation. Great balance - lightly sweet cereal grains are complimented by moderately bitter citrus rinds and pith. Finishes mildly bitter, astringent and bone-dry. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!

2 bouteilles de 750 ml partagées lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur dagrumes avec une pointe de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales et doranges avec une pointe dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Pallete: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement citronné. (Rating #3901)

Bottle, split with mcberko. Pours pale cloudy golden yellow with small white lacing. Aroma of yeast, hay, cereal, funk and barnyard. Flavour of yeast, cereal, lots of funk and lemon. Well-balanced, interesting flavours for the ABV.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2013 750ml bottle. Again thanks to Wallace... Pours a hazy yellowish brown, mostly non-transparent , and topped with a large fluffy soapy white Head... Aroma is floral with a semi-bitter yet sweet fruitiness. Some grapefruit alongside juicy fruit remains abundant. Vibrant... Flavors are as vibrant and assertive just the same and so nice for a low abv beer. Floral, fruity, earthy and dry. Softer bodied with adequate carbonation. So easy going and packing an assertive flavor and aroma profile to boot.

Sampled again on 6/2 with a fall 2012 batch. That tart yeast character took off in this like it did with Arthur. Grassy tart nose with an even more tart flavor profile. So good.

Bottle... Dark straw body, a light off white head... Light nose of a bit of sweet malt and a floral note but then has a bit of a skunk note that I dont love, but still good... Taste is a bit weak, but a nice floral bitterness, great for a 4% beer

750mL bottle, sent from gn0sis (thanks Eric), pours cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma is very funky, with horse blanket, herbs / spices and yeast. Flavour is quite rustic, with lots of barnyard, loads and loads of yeast, citrus and hay. Quite flavourful for being only 4%.

Bottle thanks to gn0sis. On first smell and taste this reminded me slightly of bam biere. Poured a light cloudy straw yellow orange color with a good size head. Aroma is yeasty and bready with a very light funk sneaking through, citrus also. Very flavorful and easy to drink. If I could only brew this myself it would probably be one of my favorite everyday beers.

750mL bottle, courtesy of joet. Thanks, Joe! Pours a hazy, grapefruit color; small-bubbled white head. Vibrant lemon and toasty wheat notes in the nose; some pepper. Medium body; modest carbonation; lively wheatiness and citrus, with a toasty core and some light peppery notes. Very drinkable, crisp, toasty, with that assertive wheat. Lasting, toasty and dry finish; husky.

Cloudy yellowish pour, nice big white head.  Aroma is dusty, lemony, lightly spicy, good dank yeast notes.  Flavor is so delicious and light on the tongue.  Quite an amazing beer, yeasty, dry, lightly fruit.  Just too easy to drink!

750 ml bottle from the brewery.  Pours a deep very cloudy yellow gray swill with a thick and foamy white head.  Aroma of zesty lemongrass, orange peel, hops and farmhouse yeast.  Taste of fresh zesty lemongrass, citrus peel, yeast and hops.  Fresh, crisp and very enjoyable.

another very unique and tasty quaff, its like a wheat saison almost. terrific drink for a very hot day. Wheaty, slightly salty, lemony balanced with a mild malt sweetness, crisp greens, what a deliciously simple and well executed brew.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Gold in colour with strong carbonation. Aroams are of lemon pith, white pepper, and some kind of flaked grain (wheat or spelt). Quite lemony in the mouth, backed by notes of oatmeal, herbal hops, and a bit of subtle spice. Crisp with a bit of hop bitterness on the back end. Really refreshing stuff. A fantastic session beer.

Bottle at Leightons Aug 11 tasting. It pours hazy straw yellow, with a massive white head. The nose is white bread, grass, leafy, farmyard, nettles and pepper. The taste is lemon, lime, grass, white farmhouse bread, cornflake, pepper, spice and soap, with a light bitter finish. Light body and fine, foamy carbonation. Smooth, clean flavour, well balanced and easy drinking. Decent.

Thanks to Avalon68 for opening this up to compare with the forthcoming grisette from Terry. Served in a short tumbler.

Pours a nice, slightly-hazed straw-yellow with a good, sticky white head that persists for quite sometime and leaves a sheet of solid lace on the sides of the glass.

Nose brings forward some nice aromas of white pepper with a little bit of black in there. Notes of earth as well as straw come through. Mild wheaty character. Great lemon rind comes through as well, quickly becoming the most-dominant portion of the brew. Flavor is similarly intense, yet mellow at the same time. Subtle fruit notes plus a nice bit of pepper and yeast throughout. Lemon rind abounds.

Light body with good carbonation and a very nice finish, which is fairly dry. Thirst-quenching and delicious. This is quite the session brew. This was the first grisette that Ive had, and Shaun really did wonders for the style.

A: The beer pours a cloudy pale yellow color with a big white head.

S: Somewhat funky with a very floral aroma.  Theres a light lemon/lemon zest note with some mild herbal notes.  Slightly peppery with some cracker malts and a hint of skunk.

T: The flavor is heavy on the cracker/pale malt flavors and pepper.  Highly floral and very yeasty.  There is a faint herbal quality to the beer which is nice.  A touch of grass is also present.

M: Light in body with a medium level of carbonation.

O: Light and easy drinking with good flavors.  Good warm weather beer.

Bottle at a tasting. Pours hazy, yellow-gold with a huge, pure white head. Mild grass in the aroma, some yeast, light funk. Light sweet flavor, lovely understated sweetness, light grassy bitters. Light bodied with lively and smooth carbonation. Super clean finish, light sugar, good grass, light funk. Extremely drinkable. Great stuff.

Sampled from the bottle at Woodshop bottle share. Murky golden in color with plenty of white head. Nice aromas of lemon and spice. Flavors present were  earthy cheesy and grassy initially. Definitely some funky barnyard in there as well. Peppercorn and spice in the middle. Pretty light in body. The finish contains some bitter hop presence which makes this beer incredibly complex. Loved this beer alot !

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2012 My Bottom Line :  
Oranges, wheat and herbal hops ride this Grisettes fluffy effervescence, as citrusy tartness, a milky touch and spicy hop bitterness seal each gulp. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam tops the murky yellow beige. Foam recedes quickly to a ring.
-This is obviously very drinkable, yet it delivers lots of complexity. Impressive.
-The finishing hop bitterness is quite lengthy (when fresh). This endurance is not really necessary, but I wont complain.
-Dryness makes it all the more enjoyable in the long run.
-The milky angles are almost lactic.

Bottles.
on tap at brewpub. pale murky grey-ish yellow, tall white pinkish head. grassy and piney hops, fresh malts, cereals, very yeasty. grapefruity medium long finish. very nice.

Pouring at Hill Farmsteads saison festival when Andy, Max, Pearl and I took a roadtrip to Montreal and then Vermont, and then again from a growler I took to James mead tasting.  Pours a hazed yellow gold with a thin to medium sized white head.  Sweet lemon and wheat, lightly floral musk.  Wheat, light and musky.  More yeast notes, big and fuzzy. Sweet wheat on the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2011 On tap at HFS saison fest. Pours a murky of yellow slightly tan head that falls quickly. Scent is extra grassy earthy scents, hay, grain, grass... with a sweet maltiness and funky esters. taste is grainy sweet dry malt with funky esters. light sessionable flavor. Mouthfeel is medium body with a moderate carbonation. overall enjoyable 
updated for a bottle conditioned 750ml. Drier than on tap nicer head retention lovely crisp saison esters. Would like to have more of this

I started and ended the saison festival with this one, at the farmstead. First pour was extremely murky yellow, final pour was hazy. Large off white head, solid lacing. Aroma is earthy, malty, with light spice. Taste is full bodied malt and citrus with spice apparent. Nice.
Light cloudy yellow color with a white soapy head.  Aroma of barnyard funk  and wheat.   Funky wheat flavor, spice, and pepper.  Very crisp and light.  Quite nice for a summer beer.

Hazy, dull blonde appearance; herbal, cheese, pungent wheat and funk aroma; both bright and dusty; tastes of mild stone fruits, some herbs and peppercorns, and the sensation of basement mildew.  Mild, crisp palate that dies with a quick bitter bite.  Both soothingly calm and arrestingly dry, and achieving a level of complexity at four percent thats really something.  Very cool stuff.
